document_title: Right-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
If not treated promptly, a right-sided migraine can lead to many dangerous complications. Specifically, people with right-sided migraines have a higher risk of cerebral infarction and stroke than normal. (3)
In addition, right-sided migraines can also affect brain function, causing memory loss. People with right-sided migraines are often at risk of visual impairment, retinal degeneration, vision loss, etc.
The effects of migraines also have an impact on mental health, making patients susceptible to anxiety disorders, depression, prolonged stress, etc. due to excessive worry.
Frequent right-sided migraines lead to impaired brain function
